signal¶

signal($signal, $callable)

Creates a new signal handler.

Parameters:
  • $signal (string|integer|object) – Signal to attach the handle.
  • $callable (object) – Callable
Return type:

object|boolean Handle, boolean if error

null_exhaust¶

null_exhaust($handle)¶

Creates a never exhausting signal handler.

Parameters:$handle (callable|handle) – PHP Callable or XPSPLHandle object.
Return type:object Handle

high_priority¶

high_priority($handle)¶

Creates or sets a handle with high priority.

Parameters:$handle (callable|handle) – PHP Callable or XPSPLHandle object.
Return type:object Handle

low_priority¶

low_priority($handle)¶

Creates or sets a handle with low priority.

Parameters:$handle (callable|handle) – PHP Callable or XPSPLHandle object.
Return type:object Handle

priority¶

priority($handle, $priority)

Sets a handle priority.

Parameters:
  • $handle (callable|handle) – PHP Callable or XPSPLHandle object.
  • $priority (integer) – Priority
Return type:

object Handle

remove_handle¶

remove_handle($signal, $handle)¶

Remove a sig handler.

Parameters:
  • $signal (string|integer|object) – Signal handle is attached to.
  • $handle (object) – Handle instance.
Return type:

void

emit¶

emit($signal[, $event = false])

Signals an event.

Parameters:
  • $signal (string|integer|object) – Signal or a signal instance.
  • $vars (array) – Array of variables to pass the handles.
  • $event (object) – Event
Return type:

object XPSPLEvent

signal_history¶

signal_history()¶

Returns the signal history.

Return type:array

register_signal¶

register_signal($signal)¶

Registers a signal in the processor.

Parameters:$signal (string|integer|object) – Signal
Return type:object Queue

search_signals¶

search_signals($signal[, $index = false])¶

Searches for a signal in storage returning its storage node if found, optionally the index can be returned.

Parameters:
  • $signal (string|int|object) – Signal to search for.
  • $index (boolean) – Return the index of the signal.
Return type:

null|array [signal, queue]

loop¶

loop()

Starts the XPSPL loop.

Return type:void

shutdown¶

shutdown()

Sends the loop the shutdown signal.

Return type:void

import¶

import($name[, $dir = false])

Import a module.

Parameters:
  • $name (string) – Module name.
  • $dir (string|null) – Location of the module.
Return type:

void

before¶

before($signal, $handle)

Registers a function to interrupt the signal stack before a signal fires, allowing for manipulation of the event before it is passed to handles.

Parameters:
  • $signal (string|object) – Signal instance or class name
  • $handle (object) – Handle to execute
Return type:

boolean True|False false is failure

after¶

after($signal, $handle)

Registers a function to interrupt the signal stack after a signal fires. allowing for manipulation of the event after it is passed to handles.

Parameters:
  • $signal (string|object) – Signal instance or class name
  • $handle (object) – Handle to execute
Return type:

boolean True|False false is failure

XPSPL¶

XPSPL()¶

Returns the XPSPL processor.

Return type:object XPSPLProcessor

clean¶

clean([$history = false])

Cleans any exhausted signal queues from the processor.

Parameters:$history (boolean) – Erase any history of the signals cleaned.
Return type:void

delete_signal¶

delete_signal($signal[, $history = false])¶

Delete a signal from the processor.

Parameters:
  • $signal (string|object|int) – Signal to delete.
  • $history (boolean) – Erase any history of the signal.
Return type:

boolean

erase_signal_history¶

erase_signal_history($signal)¶

Erases any history of a signal.

Parameters:$signal (string|object) – Signal to be erased from history.
Return type:void

disable_signaled_exceptions¶

disable_signaled_exceptions([$history = false])¶

Disables the exception handler.

Parameters:$history (boolean) – Erase any history of exceptions signaled.
Return type:void

erase_history¶

erase_history()¶

Cleans out the entire event history.

Return type:void

save_signal_history¶

save_signal_history($flag)¶

Sets the flag for storing the event history.

Parameters:$flag (boolean) –
Return type:void

listen¶

listen($listener)

Registers a new event listener object in the processor.

Parameters:$listener (object) – The event listening object
Return type:void

dir_include¶

dir_include($dir[, $listen = false[, $path = false]])¶

Performs a inclusion of the entire directory content, including subdirectories, with the option to start a listener once the file has been included.

Parameters:
  • $dir (string) – Directory to include.
  • $listen (boolean) – Start listeners.
  • $path (string) – Path to ignore when starting listeners.
Return type:

void

$i¶

$i()

This is some pretty narly code but so far the fastest I have been able to get this to run.

current_signal¶

current_signal([$offset = false])¶

Returns the current signal in execution.

Parameters:$offset (integer) – In memory hierarchy offset +/-.
Return type:object

current_event¶

current_event([$offset = false])¶

Returns the current event in execution.

Parameters:$offset (integer) – In memory hierarchy offset +/-.
Return type:object

on_shutdown¶

on_shutdown($function)¶

Call the provided function on processor shutdown.

Parameters:$function (callable|object) – Function or handle object
Return type:object XPSPLHandle

on_start¶

on_start($function)¶

Call the provided function on processor start.

Parameters:$function (callable|object) – Function or handle object
Return type:object XPSPLHandle

XPSPL_flush¶

XPSPL_flush()¶

Empties the storage, history and clears the current state.

Return type:void
